question_text: What is a key difference between tethering and a mobile hotspot?
answer_options: Tethering supports multiple users; hotspots only support one
Hotspots require a USB connection; tethering does not
Tethering connects one device; hotspots support multiple devices
correct_answer: Tethering connects one device; hotspots support multiple devices
explanation: Tethering is typically a one-to-one connection (e.g., phone to laptop), while a mobile hotspot enables one-to-many connections using Wi-Fi.
